channel.title: Internet Connection Issues
channel.description: Alright so I have my desktop pc that I built upstairs in my room. My router is on the opposite side of the house in a straight line(basically) down a floor. Would that cause any issues with making the connection slow up? Whenever I go on YouTube my connection slows(Not just me, My mom's computers connection slows too when this happens). I'm just wondering why the connection slows when I go on YouTube because no other sites slow me down. Could it be how far away I am from the router or something else?

item.title: Internet Connection Issues
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.description:
@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:2, topic:408301”][quote author=sp11k3t3ht3rd link=topic=509586.msg3697166#msg3697166 date=1312506802]
Alright so I have my desktop pc that I built upstairs in my room. My router is on the opposite side of the house in a straight line(basically) down a floor.
[/quote]

I have the exact same thing, it’s no different than being a foot away from the router for me, but it’s not on the COMPLETE opposite side of the house. Why not get a 100ft+ internet cable and run it through the walls/floor? Might cost a little bit, it’s all worth it! /sarcasm

Move the router closer if you have the ability to.[/quote]

I can’t move it closer and it’s definitely the distance because I brought my laptop up and it couldn’t load the YouTube video normally (its taken like at least a half hour and its not fully loaded) but my connection hasn’t slowed up. Weird.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet Connection Issues
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

sp11k3t3ht3rd:

Alright so I have my desktop pc that I built upstairs in my room. My router is on the opposite side of the house in a straight line(basically) down a floor.

I have the exact same thing, it’s no different than being a foot away from the router for me, but it’s not on the COMPLETE opposite side of the house. Why not get a 100ft+ internet cable and run it through the walls/floor? Might cost a little bit, it’s all worth it! /sarcasm

Move the router closer if you have the ability to.
